words.source: H559 (אָמַר, 'to say'), HC/Vqw3fs (conjunctive/Qal-wayyiqtol-3fs); KJV 'said', ESV 'said', NASB 'said' — all agree
Preposition lamed + suffix 3fs, HR/Sp3fs; KJV 'to her', ESV 'to her', NASB 'to her' — all agree
H1323 (בַּת, 'daughter'), HNcfsc (noun-common-feminine-singular-construct); KJV/ESV/NASB all render 'Pharaoh's daughter'
H3212 (הָלַךְ, 'to go/walk'), HVqv2fs (Qal-imperative-2fs); KJV 'Go', ESV 'Go', NASB 'Go ahead' — all agree
H3212 (הָלַךְ, 'to go/walk'), HC/Vqw3fs (conjunctive/Qal-wayyiqtol-3fs); KJV 'the maid went', ESV 'the girl went', NASB 'the girl went' — all agree

H5959 (עַלְמָה, 'young woman/maiden'), HTd/Ncfsa (article/noun-common-feminine-singular-absolute); same word as Isaiah 7:14; KJV 'the maid', ESV 'the girl', NASB 'the girl' — here all agree it refers to Miriam as a young woman
H7121 (קָרָא, 'to call'), HC/Vqw3fs (conjunctive/Qal-wayyiqtol-3fs); KJV 'called', ESV 'called', NASB 'called' — all agree
H517 (אֵם, 'mother'), HNcfsc (noun-common-feminine-singular-construct); KJV 'the child's mother', ESV 'the child's mother', NASB 'the child's mother' — all agree
H3206 (יֶלֶד, 'child/boy'), HTd/Ncmsa (article/noun-common-masculine-singular-absolute); KJV/ESV/NASB all render 'the child'
